entry.title: Combined summary - Lightning Network
entry.summary: On June 3, 2023, Satoshi Nakamoto sent an email expressing his satisfaction with the Lightning Network. He specifically mentioned the network's ability to conduct global business with fast and secure lightning payments. In the email, he revealed that he had created a new lightning address, satoshi@vistomail.com. This move was aimed at preventing Craig Wright from suing people and falsely claiming to be the creator of Bitcoin.Satoshi also expressed his appreciation for the Lightning team's excellent work in creating a global business platform with fast and secure lightning payments. He added his lightning address, contact@secureanonymoussurfing.com, as a way to compliment the team for their achievements.However, there were concerns raised about the ownership of the Vistomail domain. Peter Todd pointed out that the updated whois records and website content indicated a change in ownership. He suggested blocking the entire domain, as he believed it could be used by scammers pretending to be Satoshi.Despite the concerns, Satoshi reiterated his confidence in the Lightning Network's success and scalability. He praised its ability to process more transactions per second than traditional banking systems. He emphasized that Bitcoin's success is evident and surpasses that of traditional financial institutions.Overall, Satoshi Nakamoto's email highlighted his satisfaction with the Lightning Network's achievements and its role in conducting global business through fast and secure lightning payments. The concerns regarding the ownership of the Vistomail domain were acknowledged but did not undermine Satoshi's confidence in the network's success and scalability.
